intro: Sida leitaofilhoi, commonly known as the Brazilian mallow, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sida leitaofilhoi is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded areas.
